results.title: The Earthling
results.creator_credit: Peter Collinson, John Strong, Elliot Schick and Samuel Z Arkoff
results.brief_description: Patrick Foley, dying presumably of cancer, returns from America to his outback country town. There, after the briefest of conversations with long-lost acquaintances, he sets off over the mountains to a remote and hidden valley where his father once carved out a small farm. On his way, he comes accross Shawn Daley, who has just seen his mother and father die in a campervan accident. Lost, angry and afraid, Shawn seeks Patrick’s help but is coldly rebuffed. The irascible Patrick wants nothing to do with anybody else and tells the boy he must fend for himself. Shawn has no choice but to keep hounding Patrick, and the rest of the film is the changing relationship between this dying man and a dependent child. Cast includes William Holden, Ricky Schroder, Jack Thompson and Olivia Hamnett.

results.title: The Earth trembles = La terra trema
results.creator_credit: Luchino Visconti, Salvo D'Angelo and Universalia Film
results.brief_description: La terra trema tells the story of the Valestro family and their struggle to survive as fishermen in the Sicilian village Aci Trezza. A fantastic example of neo-realism, Luchino Visconti uses non-professional actors and focuses on the tightly knit Valestro family to create a gripping and moving account of poverty in Southern Italy. With beautiful photography by G.R. Aldo and narration by Visconti and Antonio Pietrangeli. Won the Special Prize in the 1948 Venice Film Festival. Franco Zeffirelli worked as an assitant director. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: The Earth reveals
results.creator_credit: Ian Dunlop, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Mineral mining in Australia and the never-ending search for new resources: gold at Kalgoorlie; lead, zinc and silver at Broken Hill and the floatation process used; mining at Iron Knob in South Australia; copper and lead at Mt Isa; uranium at Mary Kathleen; and search for oil in Queensland and New Guinea.

results.title: The Earth in motion
results.creator_credit: Walter Bartky and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: Deals with the dynamic aspects of the earth as a planet. Demonstrates: 1. Sphericity. - 2. Axis rotation established by star trails and the Foucault pendulum. - 3. Revolution around the sun by the motion of the sun in respect of the stars and by the annual parallax of the stars.

results.title: The Earth beneath me
results.brief_description: Follow Dick Smith as he travels solo around the world in his Bell Jetranger across some of the most inhospitable and lonely places in the world; the Arctic Circle; the deserts of Africa; the jungles of South East Asia. He also flies over some the world most famous landmarks; the Leaning Tower of Pisa, the Parthenon, Pyramids, Mount Everest, Taj Mahal and Australia’s own, Sydney Opera House. No other production details available. Warning; there are tracking problems at the start of the video and the image drops out during the end credits.

results.title: The Earth and its movement around the sun
results.brief_description: The earth with its tilted axis travels round the sun once every year. There are four important stages on this journey which are responsible for producing our four seasons: summer, autumn, winter and spring. The film details this journey.

results.title: The Earth's movements
results.brief_description: Shows four movements of the earth. Explains rotation and revolution and indicates how these account for day and night, time differences and the seasons. Illustrates the procession of the equinoxes and the galactic rotation. Suitable for secondary level.
results.description: Shows four movements of the earth. Explains rotation and revolution and indicates how these account for day and night, time differences and the seasons. Illustrates the procession of the equinoxes and the galactic rotation. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: The Ears and hearing
results.brief_description: Structure and functions of the human ear and how sound waves are transmitted to the brain. Discusses hearing loss and physical malfunctioning and deterioration of the ear.

results.title: The early films of Hans Richter = Ghosts before breakfast
results.brief_description: This surrealist experimental film was made in 1927 by artist-painter Hans Richter. The nazis destroyed the sound version of this film and classified it as “degenerate art”. The film shows everyday objects rebelling against their daily routine.

results.title: The Eagle has landed [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: John Sturges, David Niven Jr, Jack Wiener and ITC Entertainment
results.brief_description: A Colonel with the Luftwaffe, imprisoned for striking a fellow officer, is offered a lifeline when Nazi Colonel Radl (Robert Duvall) asks him to lead a daring suicide mission to kidnap Winston Churchill. Radl has received direct orders from Heinrich Himmler (Donald Pleasance), who in turn, has been instructed by Hitler himself. The PM is known to be holidaying in Norfolk, so recently released prisoner Karl Steiner (Michael Caine) and his men parachute into Sudley Constable, a small village nearby, camouflaged as Polish allies. The sixteen man team comprises of a motley crew of stereotypes, including a honey voiced IRA man Liam Devlin (Donald Sutherland), who dupes a young girl on horseback (Jenny Agutter) - one of the few women in the film. After an incident in which one of his men saves the life of a local boy, their mission is jeopardised when the rescuer is killed and his Nazi identity revealed beneath the Polish garb. Steiner and his men take refuge in a Church as they await the arrival of Churchill to complete the Fuhrer’s orders. Based on the Jack Higgins novel, this was the last film John Sturges (The Great escape, The Magnificent seven) directed before his death in 1992. Cast also includes Anthony Quayle, Jean Marsh, Treat Williams and Larry Hagman. Screenplay by Tom Mankiewicz.
